cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles NW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast, expected to cross Florida’s Big Bend Monday and then sweep northeastward just offshore the Georgia/South Carolina coast and up the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Indian Pass area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – interests along NE Florida through southern South Carolina advised to monitor.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL (Gulf side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, northeastern Florida Atlantic coast, Georgia and southern South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (35–45 mph) possible late Monday night through Tuesday morning at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible, likely less than 2 ft along the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain of 1–3 inches may accompany the system as it passes.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in squalls cannot be ruled out.
